title.narrative: (904.1) A SECOND CHANCE FOR ADOLESCENTS

description.narrative: A SECOND CHANCE FOR ADOLESCENTS â€“ Capacity of government and community systems are built to engage with adolescents through participatory and people-centred processes and with a focus on resilience building and equality of opportunities for adolescents facing multiple deprivations., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Empowerment (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Resilience of adolescents strengthened including the most marginalized allowing for their active participating in all affairs, including building peaceful societies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: A SECOND CHANCE FOR ADOLESCENTS ? Capacity of government and community systems are built to engage with adolescents throughparticipatory and people-centred processes and with a focus on resilience building and equality of opportunities for adolescentsfacing multiple deprivations.

description.narrative: Young people were most affected by the Covid-19 crisis resulting in increasing demands for meaningful youth participation, improved policies, data and action, UNICEF-ECAROstrengthened its youth development and participation programming, amplifying youth voices on issues like social inclusion, lifelong learning, green transitions, access to appropriate, gender-sensitive information and services, and supporting COs in scaling-up skills-building programmes, school-to work transitions, building socio-emotional and MH skills and supporting digitalization and innovation initiatives. ECAR COs, including those developing new CPDs, were supported to strengthen adolescent and youth programming, responding to increased attention by governments, UN Agencies and European institutions to youth issues. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/04/2022
